newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.

text.p: Dutch shares reached record intra-day and closing highs on Wednesday with the surging dollar the key to stronger multinationals and exporters, dealers said.
The AEX index of 25 leading stocks ended up 8.96 points at 681.28, having earlier hit an intra-day peak of 685.10. All but two of the AEX stocks rose.
"Nobody wants to sell right now even though they think its overbought," said one trader.
Behind much of the rise was the soaring dollar which for most of the day held above 1.84 guilders, the dollar's highest level the since its tumble in June 1994.
Despite the bull run, nervousness was a common sentiment.
"There doesn't seem to be any structure at the moment. There's been a lot of short-covering. But there's not that much confidence," said a trader.
Nevertheless, the reluctance to sell and buy on any dip persisted.
"When it does sell-off, everybody rushes in to buy again," said one.
Some traders said the market could hold around an AEX level of 680, but might need a few days to consolidate. One said the market greatly needed a "time out".
